sorry for late response, I'm very busy recently.
I mean you should config DataSourceProxy instead of DruidDataSource in ShardingSphere.
ShardingDataSource works on sharding and DataSourceProxy works on seata-transaction.
in fact, we haven't verify it in this way, you may face on some problems during integration.
have you resolve your problem yet?
@terrymanu  yes, sure. Could you please give some advice? Many thanks!

> have you resolve your problem yet?
Yes, I override getDataSource in the SpringBootConfiguration configuration，No problems were found after testing.
Thank you for your reply！
ok, have a good day~

Hello, there are 2 questions need to be answered:

1. How to use Sharding-Proxy to control your MySQL-cluster?

Sharding-Proxy is just like a normal MySQL, it implement MySQL protocol, end-user do not need separate Sharding-Proxy and MySQL. End-user just use port which Sharding-Proxy exposed to execute SQL, Sharding-Proxy will sent to SQL to correct backend MySQL instances.

2. How about the performance?

We are doing a task which is show the benchmark result with Sharding-Proxy and connection MySQL directly. The task will finish in few weeks. Please keep focus on this task, we will update new information in future.

I have reviewed your demo, I think you should forget JTA configuration in sharding-transaciton.
sharding transaction can simply integrate with spring DataSourceTransactionManager.
we have developed a experimental spring starter before, you can refer it in [sharding-transaction-spring](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl/tree/master/sharding-spring), and [here](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl-example/tree/master/transaction-example/transaction-2pc-xa-example) is example 

hope this will help you.

@terrymanu That is just so fantastic! Thank you very much terry.

So I just need start one Sharding-Proxy `Bootstrap` server, with correct port and other configuration, then everything will be ready. Is that true?

> I have reviewed your demo, I think you should forget JTA configuration in sharding-transaciton.
> sharding transaction can simply integrate with spring DataSourceTransactionManager.
> we have developed a experimental spring starter before, you can refer it in [sharding-transaction-spring](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl/tree/master/sharding-spring), and [here](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl-example/tree/master/transaction-example/transaction-2pc-xa-example) is example
> 
> hope this will help you.

The [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) does not use the JTA configuration. The GenericConfiguration(the class with JTA configuration) is not added the @Configuration annotation, and is not imported by ShardingJdbcSampleBootstrap(the main class). In fact, it does not take effect in the default scenario(only ShardingConfiguration is effect), you can ignore it. The [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) keep it just to do a comparison with a standard xa-data-source when needed.

> > I have reviewed your demo, I think you should forget JTA configuration in sharding-transaciton.
> > sharding transaction can simply integrate with spring DataSourceTransactionManager.
> > we have developed a experimental spring starter before, you can refer it in [sharding-transaction-spring](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl/tree/master/sharding-spring), and [here](https://github.com/OpenSharding/shardingsphere-spi-impl-example/tree/master/transaction-example/transaction-2pc-xa-example) is example
> > hope this will help you.
> 
> The [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) does not use the JTA configuration. The GenericConfiguration(the class with JTA configuration) is not added the @configuration annotation, and is not imported by ShardingJdbcSampleBootstrap(the main class). In fact, it does not take effect in the default scenario(only ShardingConfiguration is effect), you can ignore it. The [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) keep it just to do a comparison with a standard xa-data-source when needed.

In fact, the [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) is written with reference to [transaction-sample](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-example). The only difference between them is that it didn't add the @ShardingTransactionType(TransactionType.XA) annotation in the service, and even if this annotation is added, it is also incompatible with the declarative transaction.

Well, in order to make this sample( [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902) ) looks simple, I have deleted all the classes that are not related to shardingjdbc, and at your request, the transaction manager is also explicitly changed to DataSourceTransactionManager, but it is still not compatible with the declaration Transaction.
OK, let me check it again.

I have got some hints from your example.

1. `@Transactional` annotation only hold the connection managed by `DataSourceTransactionMananger`, it will not see the connection created from your biz code. so after completing `doCreateOrder`, the connection has been auto committed.
 
2. `@ShardingTransactionType` only take effect when your include `sharding-transaction-jdbc-spring` dependency in your project. since we have not deploy it in maven center repository, you should install the `shardingsphere-spi-impl` by yourself. 

3. in your example, transaction type is Local instead of XA, so transaction manager will not execute rollback.
and you can use `DataSourceUtils.getConnection(shardingDataSource)` in your biz code to get the connection managed by @Transactional, I have tested it.

> and you can use `DataSourceUtils.getConnection(shardingDataSource)` in your biz code to get the connection managed by @transactional, I have tested it.

I have added the sharding-transaction-jdbc-spring dependency and solved the problem after getting the connection through DataSourceUtils.getConnection(DataSource). However, I still think that the operation of getting the connection through DataSourceUtils should be encapsulated by shardingjdbc instead of the business system. Of course, this is my personal opinion.

Another problem is that the support for transaction propagation level REQUIREDS_NEW of declarative transactions is still incorrect. I have updated to the [shardingjdbc-sample](https://github.com/liuyangming/shardingjdbc-sample/tree/issue-2902), the latest code can reproduce this problem. The DataSourceTransactionManager has no problem with the begin & commit/rollback control of the transaction. However, the completion of the two transactions involved is confusing.
Please provide your full sharding configuration and SQLs. If possible, provide example code which can reproduce your problem will be better.

@DongJigong ,  your question is not problem caused by ShardingSphere.
JPA will do query before persisting, if the entity has existed, the entity will not persist and return directly.

you can try to use original JDBC. it also query your table before update.

If you ask why the query will route to all actual node, the reason is the query generated by JPA without sharding column, it will cause full-routing.

> @DongJigong , your question is not problem caused by ShardingSphere.
> JPA will do query before persisting, if the entity has existed, the entity will not persist and return directly.
> 
> you can try to use original JDBC. it also query your table before update.
> 
> If you ask why the query will route to all actual node, the reason is the query generated by JPA without sharding column, it will cause full-routing.

I have got your point. If I use JPA with Hsql, it could avoid a full-routing query? @KomachiSion
This will depend on your HSQL, if your HSQL still generate without sharding column, it will do full-routing again.
it's just my advice for your example code to use `DataSourceUtils.getConnection`. in fact, mybatis-spring, or jpa will invoke this method in their framework, biz code will not consider about it.

about REQUIRED_NEW of XA, we have discussed in #2854, it can't be supported now.
enlisted resources was hold in threadLocal, it seems we should hold it in a Map(key was transaction), you can try to push a PR for it.
also If you have some ideas of spring-sharding-transaction, we can optimize it together.
Please show your error info

This allows you to query all of them. “show full tables from  'tbname1 '”
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13394604/63484774-67323d00-c4d3-11e9-8c17-e38a10636d68.png)
It just doesn't support it. ‘like’   
https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/incubator/shardingsphere/4.0.0-RC1/apache-shardingsphere-incubating-4.0.0-RC2-sharding-proxy-bin.tar.gz
Duplicate with #2622 and #2538.
Can you explain the reason to close issue?
Will close soon if no response any more
Hi, @lonyee1989 Thanks for your issue , can you fix this problem and raise a pr for [Sharding Sphere document](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-doc)? Thanks a lot
@tristaZero ok, I'll try it.

I suppose that sharding will cache the query result if result column values not change, sharding will not do the update. I think this is not a good way in order to achieve performance losing real business.
I don't think shardingsphere should be a all-in-one product.

Please add mysql driver by yourself

I think the scenarios should include:

```
Access:
Raw-JDBC
Sharding-JDBC
Sharding-Proxy

Mode:
Single routing
Database routing
Table routing
Full routing
MasterSlave
MasterSlave + Single routing
MasterSlave + Database routing
MasterSlave + Table routing
MasterSlave + Full routing
Encryption
Encryption + Single routing
Encryption + Database routing
Encryption + Table routing
Encryption + Full routing

SQL:
INSERT
UPDATE
SELECT
DELETE
```

Access(3) * Mode(14) * SQL(4) = 168 secnarios

For the 3.x don't support encryption, we can't show the comparison of this part.

Besides, I suggest that we illustrate the performance promotion to user by using ShardingSphere.

```
Access:
Raw-JDBC
Sharding-JDBC
Sharding-Proxy

Mode:
Database routing

SQL:
INSERT
UPDATE
SELECT
DELETE
```

Access(3) * Mode(1) * SQL(4) = 12 secnarios

When the database is under significant stress, horizontally shard data into more databases will improve the performance.

> Please refer to the error info.
> **Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Type is required.**
.

@Myshiner  I met the same error msg.  May be you could adjust  server.yaml conf file in the "orchestration" section like this:

orchestration:
  name: orchestration_ds
  overwrite: true
  registry:
    type: zookeeper
    namespace: orchestration
    serverLists: 127.0.0.1:2181

At least, it made my sharding-proxy started and push data into ZK successfully. 
Hope help you!

> it's just my advice for your example code to use `DataSourceUtils.getConnection`. in fact, mybatis-spring, or jpa will invoke this method in their framework, biz code will not consider about it.

Relative to shardingjdbc, the mybatis-spring and jpa are upper-level frameworks. It is not very suitable for shardingjdbc to rely on them. Furthermore, there are some business systems that use the raw DataSources directly, and shardingjdbc should also support them. 

Again, this is just my personal opinion, think about it, if you want.

> about REQUIRED_NEW of XA, we have discussed in #2854, it can't be supported now.
> enlisted resources was hold in threadLocal, it seems we should hold it in a Map(key was transaction), you can try to push a PR for it.

I will consider trying to fix this problem.

> also If you have some ideas of spring-sharding-transaction, we can optimize it together.

I do have some ideas, and I have great expectations for it. shardingjdbc is an excellent open source project, my company is currently considering it, of course, I hope that it can be more standardized.

@An0nymous0  用spring.shardingsphere.datasource.{datasourcename}.jdbcUrl=xxx 就可以了

Yup, it works, thx. but one more question, as the official doc said "If there is write operation in the same thread and database connection, all the following read operations are from the master database to ensure data consistency.", but i have tested all the versions v3.0.0 & v3.1.0 & v4.0.0, it didn't work, in the same thread, i try to insert firstly and then get select operation immediately, but it did read-write split. Any suggests ?

Thanks for your comprehension, please raise pr to [doc](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-doc).
@lonyee1989 (ﾟ▽ﾟ)/

please refer to the following test logs.
In the same thread, firstly I create a table and then insert some datas and then do select query.

2019-08-23 10:30:13.316 [ShardingSphere-Command-0] INFO  ShardingSphere-SQL - SQL: **create table pm(id int unsigned not null auto_increment primary key comment 'ID', gender tinyint(2) not null default 0 comment '0-默认, 1-男, 2-女') engine=innodb default charset=utf8mb4 comment='测试表'** ::: DataSources: neworiental_v3

@tristaZero I have submitted the update of the document.   [shardingsphere-doc#224](https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-doc/pull/224)
This is document issue, reg center's api has changed, but document does not update in time.

Already created an issue on document repo.

FYI: https://github.com/apache/incubator-shardingsphere-doc/issues/225

@lonyee1989 Hi, you checked and changed a lot of content of document, thinks a lot.
But actually, we change the api and document of encryption in the latest verssion i.e, 4.0.0.RC2 , so the description of encryption in document is right. 
`Can you delete the changes of encryption in your pr and just keep the changes about masterSlaveConfig?`

We can define 2 interface for config center and orchestration center, the example code `LeafLock ` may a interface of orchestration center.

Forced routing has a function that needs to be implemented, that is, sending SQL to the sub-table specified by the specified data source for execution.

And forced routing should not only take effect in the table that specifies the HintShardingStrategy.

For example：
```
 SELECT
	MIN(KEY_FIELD) START_KEY,
	MAX(KEY_FIELD) END_KEY,
	count(1) ROW_COUNT
FROM
	(
		SELECT
			KEY_FIELD ,@rownum:=@rownum + 1 AS rownum
	
FROM
	(select client_key as KEY_FIELD from **cif_client** where 1=1) t1,
	(SELECT @rownum := - 1) t
ORDER BY
	t1.key_field
) tt
GROUP BY
	floor(tt.rownum / 200000)

```
This is a paging SQL. I need to first cut a table into 200,000 rows as a segment. Then distribute this segment to a batch executor for processing.

```

        HintManager hintManager = HintManager.getInstance();
        hintManager.addDatabaseShardingValue(tableName,value);  **//value?!!!Where did I get the value?!!**  I already have data source name (or ID) and table name (or ID)!!
        hintManager.addTableShardingValue(tableName,value);  **//value?!!!Where did I get the value?!!**

```

```
        TableRuleConfiguration result = new TableRuleConfiguration();
        result.setLogicTable(tableName);
        result.setActualDataNodes("ds_${0..2}."+tableName+"_${0..2}");
        result.setDatabaseShardingStrategyConfig(new StandardShardingStrategyConfiguration("client_no",new CifDatabaseShardingAlgorithm()));
// I just want to execute paging statements in hint, but i must modify the Strategy of this table? what??!!!
        result.setTableShardingStrategyConfig(new StandardShardingStrategyConfiguration("client_no",new CifTableShardingAlgorithm()));
       
```

I just want this SQL to be executed in the data source name (or ID) and table name (or ID) I specify.

hint sharding must use hint sharind Strategy, just like flowing code:
**conf.setDatabaseShardingStrategyConfig(
	        new HintShardingStrategyConfiguration(hintShardingDatabaseAlgorithm));
conf.setTableShardingStrategyConfig(
	        new HintShardingStrategyConfiguration(hintShardingTableAlgorithm));**
and, hintShardingDatabaseAlgorithm is the implementation of ShardingAlgorithm

StandardShardingStrategyConfiguration is **standard** **sharding** **Strategy**, not hint

> hint sharding must use hint sharind Strategy, just like flowing code:
> **conf.setDatabaseShardingStrategyConfig( new HintShardingStrategyConfiguration(hintShardingDatabaseAlgorithm)); conf.setTableShardingStrategyConfig( new HintShardingStrategyConfiguration(hintShardingTableAlgorithm));**
> and, hintShardingDatabaseAlgorithm is the implementation of ShardingAlgorithm
> 
> StandardShardingStrategyConfiguration is **standard** **sharding** **Strategy**, not hint

but as the paging case.his table is used Hint sharding Strategy.
